article_text:
So what does it take to ruin your reputation around Washington these days? The question comes to mind after learning that one of the capitol’s most corrupt bureaucracies has decided to hire one of its most incompetent contractors—and the answer explains a lot about accountability in government.

Only days after the Internal Revenue Service announced that it would throttle back tax-season customer service in retaliation for modest budget cuts, the House Ways and Means oversight subcommittee discovered that the agency had an...

twitter.description: The IRS hires the contractor that built the health law website, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Failing Up in ObamaCare
